arundel.core

Class Circuit

  • java.lang.Object
    • arundel.core.Circuit

  • public class Circuit
extends java.lang.Object

    Class Circuit encapsulates a computational directed acyclic graph of Gates. The most important properties of this class are :

     1. All instances of Circuit contain a set of operators
    placeholders and variables.
 2. All computation is performed from the data
    - retreived from the variables,
    - performed in the Operators, and
    - stored in the placeholders.
    - compared with labels stored in the placeholders

    More specifically, the variables happen to be the roots of the computation DAG, the operators are internal nodes. Note that any terminal Gate is the leaf of this computation DAG.

    In the computation step for the Circuit, first, all the Gates are sorted topologically. Then for each Gate in this ordered list the Gate.forward() method is invoked for the forward computation. For backproagation, all the Gates are sorted in the reverse topological order and then the Gate.backward() method is invoked for backproagation. During backpropagation, the Gate.backward() method invokes the Gate.update() method which is used for updating the gate parmeters.
